ground_truth: As Tuvia contemplates the cabin full of sick people, Lilka comes in, and his eyes search her face as she hands back the revolver. At the army camp, Viktor is looking at a chart, and Tuvia has come into the camp, causing Zus to look at Tuvia and turn away. Zus comes up, and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a parked vehicle, where Tuvia is coughing and produces the ornate Mezuzah case. Zus snatches it from him and climbs out of the truck, signaling to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low, the three of them scurry across to one building and then sneak towards the police station building flying the Nazi flag. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch nervously from inside the vehicle as he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire and grips his own gun. Inside the police station, Krensky is shot dead, and Benzion fires back, killing two policemen. Tuvia trembles as Zus dives towards the next office and is shot at by the police chief, but not before gunning him to the ground. Zus runs into the office, flings open the cupboard of small medicine bottles, and scoops them up into a sack. Benzion vaults over the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle, but a policeman bursts in and plants Benzion with bullets. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman, clutching the wound in his stomach, while Tuvia's face is full of foreboding as the vehicle hurtles out of the town. Wincing with pain, Zus produces the bundle of medicine bottles, and the truck's headlights pierce the bliss of the country road. Sometime later, Shimon officiates the burial, as in his cabin, Tuvia is fighting the fever. At mealtime, as people huddle in groups, Arkady is standing at the food table and glares at Asael. Both draw knives, but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes and sheathes his knife, then saunters off, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger. At the army camp, Zus is sitting on his own as Lova, one of his group, kneels down by a basin of water, his face and hands covered in blood. Zus's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed, is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him whistling. Viktor pours another glass of vodka, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and Zus leaves the tent.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: As Tuvia ponders the lodge full of ill individuals, Lilka enters in, and his eyes scan her visage as she returns the firearm. At the military encampment, Viktor is observing a diagram, and Tuvia has arrived into the camp, prompting Zus to glance at Tuvia and turn away. Zus approaches, and later at night in the abandoned settlement of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia are seated in a stationary vehicle, where Tuvia is coughing and reveals the decorative Mezuzah case. Zus grabs it from him and exits from the truck, signaling to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low, the trio of them dash over to one structure and then creep towards the law enforcement station edifice flying the Nazi banner. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch anxiously from inside the vehicle as he jumps at the sight of illuminations flashing amid the sound of gunfire and grips his own weapon. Inside the police station, Krensky is shot deceased, and Benzion returns fire, killing two officers. Tuvia shakes as Zus lunges towards the next office and is shot at by the police leader, but not before shooting him to the ground. Zus rushes into the office, flings open the cabinet of small medicine vials, and gathers them up into a sack. Benzion leaps over the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle, but an officer bursts in and plants Benzion with bullets. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the officer, clutching the wound in his abdomen, while Tuvia's face is full of dread as the vehicle speeds out of the town. Grimacing with pain, Zus produces the bundle of medicine vials, and the truck's headlights penetrate the serenity of the country lane. Sometime later, Shimon presides over the interment, as in his lodge, Tuvia is battling the fever. At mealtime, as individuals huddle in groups, Arkady is standing at the food table and glares at Asael. Both draw daggers, but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black circles under his eyes and sheathes his dagger, then saunters off, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks worried. Asael's eyes blaze with fury. At the military encampment, Zus is sitting on his own as Lova, one of his group, kneels down by a basin of water, his face and hands covered in blood. Zus's eyes flicker in rage. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed, is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him whistling. Viktor pours another glass of vodka, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and Zus leaves the tent.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: As the cabin full of sick people is contemplated by Tuvia, Lilka comes in, and her face is searched by his eyes as the revolver is handed back by her. At the army camp, a chart is being looked at by Viktor, and into the camp Tuvia has come, causing Zus to look at him and turn away. Zus comes up, and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze, in a parked vehicle, Zus and Tuvia are sitting, the ornate Mezuzah case is produced by Tuvia as he coughs. It is snatched by Zus from him, and out of the truck he climbs, signaling to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low, across to one building the three of them scurry and then sneak towards the police station building flying the Nazi flag. From inside the vehicle, Tuvia's feverish eyes nervously watch as the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire is started at by him, and his own gun is gripped. Inside the police station, Krensky shoots dead a policeman, and Benzion fires back, killing two policemen. Tuvia trembles as the next office is dove towards by Zus and the police chief shoots at him, but not before he is gunned to the ground by Zus. The office is run into by Zus, the cupboard of small medicine bottles is flung open, and they are scooped up into a sack by him. The police counter is vaulted over by Benzion, the transmitter is reached for and smashed with the butt end of his rifle, but in bursts a policeman and Benzion is planted with bullets. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman, while the wound in his stomach is clutched by him, and Tuvia's face is filled with foreboding as the town is hurtled out of by the vehicle. With pain, Zus winces and the bundle of medicine bottles is produced, and the bliss of the country road is pierced by the truck's headlights. Sometime later, the burial is officiated by Shimon, as in his cabin, the fever is fought by Tuvia. At mealtime, in groups, people are huddled as Arkady standing at the food table glares at Asael. Knives are drawn by both, but Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes are stared at by Arkady, his knife is sheathed, then off he saunters, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger. At the army camp, Zus is on his own sitting as by a basin of water Lova, one of his group, kneels down, blood covering his face and hands. Zus's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent, the accordion is played by Viktor, bleary-eyed, with Gramov sitting by him whistling. Another glass of vodka is poured by Viktor, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. This commanding officer is glanced at by Gramov, who looks up at Zus, as the incident is dismissed by Viktor with a wave of his hand, and the tent is left by Zus.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As Tuvia considers the cabin of sick people, Lilka enters and returns the revolver. At the army camp, Viktor examines a chart as Tuvia arrives, causing Zus to look and turn away. Later, in the deserted town of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia sit in a parked vehicle. Tuvia coughs and shows an ornate Mezuzah case, which Zus grabs before signaling Benzion and Krensky. The three sneak to a building near the Nazi-flagged police station. Tuvia watches nervously from the vehicle as lights flash and gunfire erupts. Inside, Krensky is killed, and Benzion shoots two policemen. Tuvia trembles as Zus dives into the next office, shooting the police chief. Zus collects medicine bottles, while Benzion smashes a transmitter but is shot by a policeman. Zus returns, kills the policeman, and clutches his wound as the vehicle speeds away. Wincing, Zus reveals the medicine bottles as the truck's headlights cut through the night. Later, Shimon conducts a burial while Tuvia battles fever. At mealtime, Arkady and Asael draw knives, but Arkady sheathes his after seeing Tuvia's pale face. Asael watches Tuvia withdraw, and Lilka looks worried. At the army camp, Zus sits alone as Lova kneels, bloodied. Zus's eyes flicker with anger. In his tent, Viktor plays the accordion with Gramov, who is inattentive. Viktor hits Gramov, who looks at Zus, but Viktor dismisses it, and Zus leaves.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Tuvia contemplates the cabin of sick people as Lilka returns the revolver. At the army camp, Viktor examines a chart, and Tuvia's arrival causes Zus to turn away. Later, in Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia sit in a vehicle; Tuvia coughs and shows an ornate Mezuzah case. Zus takes it, signals Benzion and Krensky, and they sneak to a Nazi-flagged police station. Tuvia watches nervously as gunfire erupts. Inside, Krensky is killed, Benzion kills two policemen, and Zus shoots the police chief. Zus collects medicine bottles, and Benzion destroys a transmitter before being shot. Zus kills the policeman, and they escape. Zus, wounded, shows the medicine as they drive away. Shimon later officiates a burial while Tuvia battles fever. At mealtime, Arkady and Asael draw knives, but Arkady sheathes his, noticing Tuvia's pale face. Asael watches Tuvia withdraw, and Lilka looks anxious. At the camp, Zus sits alone as Lova cleans bloodied hands. Viktor plays accordion, drinks vodka, and hits Gramov, who looks at Zus before Viktor dismisses the incident. Zus leaves the tent.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As Tuvia stands deep in thought, contemplating the cabin filled with sick and ailing people, Lilka enters the scene. His eyes, filled with a mix of emotions, search her face intently as she returns the revolver to him. Meanwhile, at the army camp, Viktor is absorbed in examining a detailed chart, and Tuvia makes his entrance into the camp, which causes Zus to glance at Tuvia and then deliberately turn away. Zus approaches, and later that night, in the eerily deserted town of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia find themselves sitting in a parked vehicle. Tuvia, who is coughing, produces an ornate Mezuzah case. Zus quickly snatches it from him and climbs out of the truck, signaling to Benzion and Krensky to follow. Keeping their heads low to avoid detection, the three of them scurry across to one building and then stealthily make their way towards the police station building, which is ominously flying the Nazi flag. From inside the vehicle, Tuvia's feverish eyes watch nervously, and he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire, gripping his own gun tightly. Inside the police station, Krensky is tragically shot dead, and Benzion retaliates by firing back, successfully killing two policemen. Tuvia trembles with anxiety as Zus dives towards the next office, where he is shot at by the police chief, but not before he manages to gun him to the ground. Zus rushes into the office, flings open the cupboard filled with small medicine bottles, and hurriedly scoops them up into a sack. Benzion vaults over the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle, but a policeman bursts in and shoots Benzion, planting him with bullets. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman, clutching the wound in his stomach, while Tuvia's face is full of foreboding as the vehicle hurtles out of the town. Wincing with pain, Zus produces the bundle of medicine bottles, and the truck's headlights pierce through the blissful darkness of the country road. Sometime later, Shimon officiates the solemn burial, as in his cabin, Tuvia is fighting against the fever. At mealtime, as people huddle together in groups, Arkady stands at the food table and glares menacingly at Asael. Both draw their knives, but Arkady, noticing Tuvia's drawn pale face and the dark rings under his eyes, sheathes his knife and saunters off, his lip curled in disdain, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger. At the army camp, Zus is sitting alone as Lova, one of his group, kneels down by a basin of water, his face and hands covered in blood. Zus's eyes flicker with anger. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed and weary, is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him, whistling a tune. Viktor pours himself another glass of vodka, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't seem to be paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and Zus leaves the tent.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: As Tuvia stands deeply immersed in his thoughts, pondering the cabin that is filled with those who are sick and ailing, Lilka makes her entrance into the scene. Tuvia’s eyes, which convey a complex mixture of emotions, search her face intently as she hands back the revolver to him. Meanwhile, over at the army camp, Viktor is fully engrossed in scrutinizing a detailed chart, and Tuvia strides into the camp, an action that draws Zus’s attention, causing Zus to glance at Tuvia before deliberately turning away. Zus makes his approach, and later, under the cloak of night in the eerily deserted town of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia find themselves seated inside a parked vehicle. Tuvia, who is suffering from a persistent cough, produces an intricately designed Mezuzah case. Quickly, Zus snatches it from him and exits the truck, gesturing for Benzion and Krensky to join him. Keeping their heads low to avoid detection from any prying eyes, the trio hurriedly scurries across to one building and then stealthily makes their covert approach towards the police station building, which ominously displays the Nazi flag. From within the vehicle, Tuvia’s feverish eyes gaze nervously, and he starts at the sight of flashing lights, accompanied by the sound of gunfire, clutching his own gun tightly in response. Inside the police station, Krensky meets a tragic end, being shot dead, while Benzion retaliates with gunfire, successfully killing two policemen in the process. Tuvia trembles with anxiety as Zus bolts towards the adjacent office, where he is fired upon by the police chief, yet he manages to shoot him down. Zus rushes into the office, flinging open a cupboard filled with small medicine bottles, which he hurriedly gathers up into a sack. Benzion leaps across the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, and demolishes it with the butt end of his rifle, but is then overtaken as a policeman bursts in and shoots Benzion, hitting him with bullets. Zus dashes back into the front office, taking down the policeman while clutching the wound in his stomach, as Tuvia’s face reflects foreboding while the vehicle races out of the town. Wincing from the pain, Zus produces the bundle of medicine bottles, as the truck’s headlights slice through the serene darkness of the country road. Sometime later, Shimon leads the solemn burial rites, while back in his cabin, Tuvia battles against the fever. At mealtime, as people huddle together in small groups, Arkady stands menacingly at the food table, glaring at Asael. Each draws their knife, but Arkady, noticing Tuvia’s pale face and the dark rings under his eyes, sheathes his knife and saunters off, his lip curled in disdain. Asael watches as Tuvia retreats, with Lilka also appearing anxious. Asael’s eyes blaze with anger. Back at the army camp, Zus is seated alone, while Lova, a member of his group, kneels by a basin filled with water, his face and hands covered in blood. Zus’s eyes flicker with anger. Inside his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed and weary, is playing the accordion, with Gramov sitting by him, whistling a tune. Viktor pours himself another glass of vodka, and Zus indicates Gramov, who seems lost in thought and not paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, who observes the interaction as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and Zus makes his way out of the tent.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Tuvia stands amidst the cabin filled with sick individuals, he takes a moment to contemplate the scene before him, his gaze lingering on the faces around him. Just then, Lilka enters the room, and Tuvia's eyes immediately search her face with a mix of emotions as she approaches him. She extends her hand to return the revolver, and he accepts it, their eyes briefly meeting in silent understanding. Meanwhile, at the army camp, Viktor is intently examining a chart, his focus unwavering, when Tuvia arrives at the camp. This unexpected presence causes Zus to glance at Tuvia, only to quickly avert his gaze, a silent tension hanging in the air. As the day progresses, Zus approaches Tuvia, and later that night, they find themselves in the deserted town of Stakiewicze. The two brothers sit in a parked vehicle, the silence between them punctuated by Tuvia's persistent cough. In a moment of vulnerability, Tuvia retrieves an ornate Mezuzah case, holding it briefly before Zus snatches it from him. Zus then climbs out of the truck, signaling to Benzion and Krensky to follow his lead. The three men, keeping their heads low to avoid detection, scurry across the open space to one building, their movements quick and deliberate. They then stealthily make their way towards the police station, which is ominously flying the Nazi flag. From inside the vehicle, Tuvia's feverish eyes dart nervously, his heart racing as he starts at the sudden sight of lights flashing and the sound of gunfire echoing through the night. Instinctively, he grips his own gun, ready for any threat. Inside the police station, chaos erupts as Krensky is shot dead, his body falling lifelessly to the ground. In response, Benzion fires back with precision, taking down two policemen in quick succession. Tuvia, still trembling with anxiety, watches as Zus makes a daring dive towards the next office, narrowly avoiding bullets fired by the police chief. In a swift and decisive move, Zus guns the chief to the ground, ensuring their path is clear. He then rushes into the office, flinging open a cupboard filled with small medicine bottles, which he hurriedly scoops into a sack. Meanwhile, Benzion vaults over the police counter with agility, reaching for the transmitter and smashing it with the butt end of his rifle to prevent any calls for reinforcements. However, a policeman bursts in, catching Benzion off guard and riddling him with bullets. Zus, hearing the commotion, runs back into the front office and, with a determined expression, guns down the policeman, even as he clutches a wound in his stomach. Tuvia's face is etched with foreboding as the vehicle speeds out of the town, the urgency of their escape palpable. Despite wincing with pain, Zus manages to produce the bundle of medicine bottles, a small victory amid the chaos, as the truck's headlights cut through the darkness of the country road. Sometime later, Shimon solemnly officiates a burial, the weight of loss heavy in the air, while in his cabin, Tuvia battles the relentless fever that grips him. At mealtime, the atmosphere is tense as people huddle in groups, seeking comfort in numbers. Arkady stands at the food table, his eyes narrowing as he glares at Asael, a silent challenge passing between them. Both men draw knives, the metallic sound sharp in the air, but Arkady pauses, his gaze shifting to Tuvia's drawn, pale face and the dark rings under his eyes. With a reluctant sigh, he sheathes his knife and saunters off, his lip curled in disdain, leaving Asael to watch Tuvia withdraw into himself, while Lilka looks on with growing anxiety. Asael's eyes blaze with anger, the tension simmering beneath the surface. Back at the army camp, Zus sits alone, his thoughts a turbulent mix of emotions, as Lova, one of his group, kneels by a basin of water, his face and hands stained with blood. Zus's eyes flicker with anger, the sight stirring something deep within him. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed and weary, plays the accordion, the melancholic notes filling the air as Gramov sits beside him, whistling along. Viktor pours another glass of vodka, the liquid sloshing slightly as he gestures towards Gramov, who seems lost in his own world, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face in frustration. Gramov glances up at his commanding officer, his expression a mix of surprise and resignation, before looking to Zus for some form of acknowledgment. Viktor dismisses the incident with a casual wave of his hand, as if it were of no consequence, and Zus, feeling the weight of the moment, leaves the tent, his mind heavy with unspoken thoughts.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As Tuvia contemplates the cabin full of sick people, Lilka returns the revolver, and he searches her face. At the army camp, Tuvia's arrival causes Zus to look at him and turn away. Later, in the deserted town of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia sit in a parked vehicle, where Tuvia, coughing, reveals an ornate Mezuzah case. Zus takes it, signals to Benzion and Krensky, and the three stealthily approach the police station flying the Nazi flag. Tuvia, feverish and nervous, watches from the vehicle as gunfire erupts. Inside, Krensky is killed, and Benzion retaliates, killing two policemen. Zus, after shooting the police chief, gathers medicine bottles into a sack. Benzion destroys the transmitter but is shot by a policeman, whom Zus then kills. Clutching his wound, Zus returns to the vehicle, and they escape the town. Later, Shimon officiates a burial while Tuvia battles a fever. During mealtime, Arkady and Asael confront each other with knives, but Arkady, noticing Tuvia's pale face, sheathes his knife and leaves, as Asael and Lilka watch Tuvia withdraw. At the army camp, Zus sits alone while Lova, covered in blood, kneels by a basin. Zus's anger flickers. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed, plays the accordion with Gramov, who is inattentive. Viktor pours vodka, swipes Gramov, and dismisses the incident, prompting Zus to leave the tent.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As Tuvia contemplates the cabin full of sick people, Lilka comes in, her presence a reminder of the many women who played crucial roles in resistance efforts during World War II, and his eyes search her face as she hands back the revolver—a weapon that symbolizes their perpetual struggle for survival. At the army camp, a temporary base set up in the dense Belorussian forests known for providing cover against enemy detection, Viktor is looking at a chart, and Tuvia has come into the camp, causing Zus to look at Tuvia and turn away with a mix of emotions tied to their shared history. Zus comes up, and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze, which had been overtaken by Nazi forces and now served as a key strategic point, Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a parked vehicle, where Tuvia is coughing and produces the ornate Mezuzah case, a sacred object that offers him comfort amidst chaos. Zus snatches it from him and climbs out of the truck, signaling to Benzion and Krensky, who, like many Jewish partisans, were committed to resisting the Nazi occupation through guerrilla warfare. Keeping their heads low, the three of them scurry across to one building and then sneak towards the police station building flying the Nazi flag, a potent symbol of oppression. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch nervously from inside the vehicle as he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire and grips his own gun, anxious about yet another confrontation. Inside the police station, Krensky is shot dead, and Benzion fires back, killing two policemen, actions that illustrate their determination to disrupt Nazi operations. Tuvia trembles as Zus dives towards the next office and is shot at by the police chief, but not before gunning him to the ground, demonstrating their gritty resolve. Zus runs into the office, flings open the cupboard of small medicine bottles vital for treating the sick in the forest camp, and scoops them up into a sack. Benzion vaults over the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, essential for Nazi communication, and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle, but a policeman bursts in and plants Benzion with bullets, highlighting the ever-present danger of their mission. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman, clutching the wound in his stomach, a grim reminder of the high stakes. Meanwhile, Tuvia's face is full of foreboding as the vehicle hurtles out of the town, carrying the precious cargo. Wincing with pain, Zus produces the bundle of medicine bottles, and the truck's headlights pierce the bliss of the country road, a temporary escape from the horrors they face. Sometime later, Shimon, a former rabbi turned partisan leader, officiates the burial, as in his cabin, Tuvia is fighting the fever, demonstrating the physical toll of their resistance. At mealtime, as people huddle in groups, Arkady is standing at the food table and glares at Asael. Both draw knives, but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes, signs of his relentless battle with illness and leadership stresses, and sheathes his knife, then saunters off, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger, reflecting the simmering tensions within their group. At the army camp, Zus is sitting on his own as Lova, one of his group who has endured numerous skirmishes, kneels down by a basin of water, his face and hands covered in blood, a testament to their relentless fight. Zus's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed from fatigue and stress, is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him whistling, an attempt to lift spirits amid the bleakness of war. Viktor pours another glass of vodka, a common method of coping with the harsh realities they face, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and Zus leaves the tent, burdened by the strains of command and the ongoing conflict.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: As Tuvia contemplates the cabin full of sick people Lilka comes in and his eyes search her face as she hands back the revolver. At the army camp Viktor is looking at a chart and Tuvia has come into the camp causing Zus to look at Tuvia and turn away. Zus comes up and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a parked vehicle where Tuvia is coughing and produces the ornate Mezuzah case. Zus snatches it from him and climbs out of the truck signaling to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low the three of them scurry across to one building and then sneak towards the police station building flying the Nazi flag. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch nervously from inside the vehicle as he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire and grips his own gun. Inside the police station Krensky is shot dead and Benzion fires back killing two policemen. Tuvia trembles as Zus dives towards the next office and is shot at by the police chief but not before gunning him to the ground. Zus runs into the office flings open the cupboard of small medicine bottles and scoops them up into a sack. Benzion vaults over the police counter reaches for the transmitter and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle but a policeman bursts in and plants Benzion with bullets. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman clutching the wound in his stomach while Tuvia's face is full of foreboding as the vehicle hurtles out of the town. Wincing with pain Zus produces the bundle of medicine bottles and the truck's headlights pierce the bliss of the country road. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. Sometime later Shimon officiates the burial as in his cabin. Tuvia is fighting the fever. At mealtime as people huddle in groups Arkady is standing at the food table and glares at Asael. Both draw knives but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes and sheathes his knife then saunters off his lip curled as Asael watches. Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger. At the army camp Zus is sitting on his own as Lova. one of his group kneels down by a basin of water his face and hands covered in blood. Zus's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent Viktor blearyeyed is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him whistling. Viktor pours another glass of vodka and Zus indicates Gramov who does not appear to be paying attention prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand and Zus leaves the tent.

During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Sometime later Shimon officiates the burial as in his cabin. Tuvia is fighting the fever. At mealtime as people huddle in groups Arkady is standing at the food table and glares at Asael. Both draw knives but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes and sheathes his knife then saunters off his lip curled as Asael watches. Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger. At the army camp Zus is sitting on his own as Lova. one of his group kneels down by a basin of water his face and hands covered in blood. Zus's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent Viktor blearyeyed is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him whistling. Viktor pours another glass of vodka and Zus indicates Gramov who does not appear to be paying attention prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand and Zus leaves the tent.

At the army camp Viktor is looking at a chart and Tuvia has come into the camp causing Zus to look at Tuvia and turn away. Zus comes up and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a parked vehicle where Tuvia is coughing and produces the ornate Mezuzah case. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: As the elephant contemplates the cabin full of sick people, the dolphin comes in, and its eyes search her face as she hands back the revolver. At the army camp, the giraffe is looking at a chart, and the elephant has come into the camp, causing the kangaroo to look at the elephant and turn away. The kangaroo comes up, and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze, the kangaroo and the elephant are sitting in a parked vehicle, where the elephant is coughing and produces the ornate Mezuzah case. The kangaroo snatches it from him and climbs out of the truck, signaling to the parrot and the panda. Keeping their heads low, the three of them scurry across to one building and then sneak towards the police station building flying the Nazi flag. The elephant's feverish eyes watch nervously from inside the vehicle as he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire and grips his own gun. Inside the police station, the panda is shot dead, and the parrot fires back, killing two policemen. The elephant trembles as the kangaroo dives towards the next office and is shot at by the police chief, but not before gunning him to the ground. The kangaroo runs into the office, flings open the cupboard of small medicine bottles, and scoops them up into a sack. The parrot vaults over the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle, but a policeman bursts in and plants the parrot with bullets. The kangaroo runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman, clutching the wound in his stomach, while the elephant's face is full of foreboding as the vehicle hurtles out of the town. Wincing with pain, the kangaroo produces the bundle of medicine bottles, and the truck's headlights pierce the bliss of the country road. Sometime later, the owl officiates the burial, as in its cabin, the elephant is fighting the fever. At mealtime, as people huddle in groups, the penguin is standing at the food table and glares at the turtle. Both draw knives, but the penguin stares at the elephant's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes and sheathes his knife, then saunters off, his lip curled, as the turtle watches the elephant withdraw and the dolphin also looks anxious. The turtle's eyes blaze with anger. At the army camp, the kangaroo is sitting on his own as the mole, one of his group, kneels down by a basin of water, his face and hands covered in blood. The kangaroo's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent, the giraffe, bleary-eyed, is playing the accordion with the fox sitting by him whistling. The giraffe pours another glass of vodka, and the kangaroo indicates the fox, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting the giraffe to swipe him across the face. The fox glances at this commanding officer and looks up at the kangaroo, as the giraffe dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and the kangaroo leaves the tent.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As Tuvia contemplates the warehouse full of resting people, Lilka comes in, and his eyes search her face as she hands back the flashlight. At the navy outpost, Viktor is looking at a blueprint, and Tuvia has come into the outpost, causing Zus to look at Tuvia and turn away. Zus comes up, and later at night in the deserted village of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a parked carriage, where Tuvia is coughing and produces the ornate amulet case. Zus snatches it from him and climbs out of the bicycle, signaling to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low, the three of them scurry across to one gazebo and then sneak towards the library building flying the Nazi insignia. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch nervously from inside the carriage as he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of fireworks and grips his own slingshot. Inside the library, Krensky is shot dead, and Benzion fires back, killing two guards. Tuvia trembles as Zus dives towards the next office and is shot at by the librarian, but not before gunning him to the ground. Zus runs into the office, flings open the closet of small perfume bottles, and scoops them up into a satchel. Benzion vaults over the library counter, reaches for the microphone, and smashes it with the butt end of his crossbow, but a guard bursts in and plants Benzion with arrows. Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the guard, clutching the wound in his leg, while Tuvia's face is full of foreboding as the carriage hurtles out of the village. Wincing with pain, Zus produces the bundle of perfume bottles, and the carriage's lanterns pierce the bliss of the mountain path. Sometime later, Shimon officiates the burial, as in his warehouse, Tuvia is fighting the fever. At supper, as people huddle in groups, Arkady is standing at the dessert table and glares at Asael. Both draw daggers, but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes and sheathes his dagger, then saunters off, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious. Asael's eyes blaze with anger. At the navy outpost, Zus is sitting on his own as Lova, one of his group, kneels down by a bucket of paint, his face and hands covered in ink. Zus's eyes flicker in anger. In his tent, Viktor, bleary-eyed, is playing the banjo with Gramov sitting by him whistling. Viktor pours another glass of cider, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand, and Zus leaves the tent.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: As Tuvia examines the cabin full of sick people, Lilka arrives, and his eyes trace her face as she returns the revolver. At the army camp, Viktor is examining a chart, and Tuvia has entered the camp, prompting Zus to glance at Tuvia and turn his gaze away. Zus approaches, and later at night in the vacant town of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a stationary vehicle, where Tuvia is sneezing and reveals the ornate Mezuzah case. Zus grabs it from him and exits the truck, gesturing to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low, the three of them tiptoe across to one building and then creep towards the police station building displaying the Nazi flag. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch anxiously from inside the vehicle as he jumps at the sight of lights blinking amid the sound of shouting and clutches his own gun. Inside the police station, Krensky is hit, and Benzion retaliates, eliminating two policemen. Tuvia shivers as Zus leaps towards the next office and is fired at by the police chief, but not before knocking him to the ground. Zus dashes into the office, swings open the cupboard of small medicine bottles, and stuffs them into a sack. Benzion climbs over the police counter, reaches for the transmitter, and smashes it with the handle of his rifle, but a policeman storms in and fills Benzion with bullets. Zus races back into the front office and takes down the policeman, gripping the wound in his side, while Tuvia's face is full of dread as the vehicle speeds out of the town. Grimacing with pain, Zus reveals the bundle of medicine bottles, and the truck's headlights slice through the tranquility of the country road. Sometime later, Shimon conducts the burial, as in his cabin, Tuvia is battling the fever. At mealtime, as people cluster in groups, Arkady is standing at the food table and glowers at Asael. Both pull out knives, but Arkady observes Tuvia's drawn pale face and the dark circles under his eyes and sheathes his knife, then strides off, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia retreat and Lilka also appears worried. Asael's eyes burn with anger. At the army camp, Zus is sitting alone as Lova, one of his group, squats by a basin of water, his face and hands smeared in blood. Zus's eyes ignite in anger. In his tent, Viktor, weary-eyed, is strumming the accordion with Gramov sitting by him humming. Viktor fills another glass of vodka, and Zus gestures to Gramov, who seems oblivious, prompting Viktor to brush him across the face. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a flick of his hand, and Zus exits the tent.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As the volcano contemplates the sculpture full of healthy animals, the telescope comes in, and its leaves search the tail as it hands back the bracelet. At the aquarium park, the piano is looking at a globe, and the volcano has come into the park, causing the raccoon to look at the volcano and turn away. The raccoon comes up, and later at night in the bustling village of Paperclip Town, the raccoon and the volcano are sitting in a parked bicycle, where the volcano is sneezing and produces the ornate toolbox. The raccoon snatches it from it and climbs out of the scooter, signaling to the furnace and the mailbox. Keeping their fingers high, the three of them sprint across to one window and then sneak towards the library window flying the pirate flag. The volcano's feverish leaves watch nervously from inside the bicycle as it starts at the sight of lights blinking amid the sound of fireworks and grips its own wrench. Inside the library window, the mailbox is smashed dead, and the furnace fires back, painting two oranges. The volcano trembles as the raccoon dives towards the next bookshelf and is painted gold by the librarian, but not before painting it to the sky. The raccoon runs into the bookshelf, flings open the drawer of tiny marbles, and scoops them up into a hat. The furnace vaults over the police piano, reaches for the trumpet, and smashes it with the butt end of its telescope, but a plum bursts in and plants the furnace with fireworks. The raccoon runs back into the front bookshelf and paints down the plum, clutching the shadow in its toe, while the volcano's leaf is full of foreboding as the bicycle hurtles out of the sky. Wincing with laughter, the raccoon produces the bundle of marbles, and the car's tires pierce the bliss of the garden path. Sometime later, the hamster officiates the concert, as in its sculpture, the volcano is fighting the sneeze. At breakfast, as animals huddle in singles, the helicopter is standing at the music stand and smiles at the pencil. Both draw brushes, but the helicopter stares at the volcano's drawn pale leaf and the pink circles under its branches and sheathes its brush, then waltzes off, its toe curled, as the pencil watches the volcano withdraw and the telescope also looks calm. The pencil's ears blaze with happiness. At the aquarium park, the raccoon is sitting on its own as the igloo, one of its group, kneels down by a bowl of juice, its fingers and toes covered in chocolate. The raccoon's ears flicker in happiness. In its den, the piano, bleary-eyed, is playing the guitar with the scarecrow sitting by it whistling. The piano pours another cup of tea, and the raccoon indicates the scarecrow, who doesn't appear to be paying attention, prompting the piano to swipe it across the leaf. The scarecrow glances at this commanding window and looks up at the raccoon, as the piano dismisses the incident with a wave of its branch, and the raccoon leaves the den.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: As Clarissa ponders the library full of tired travelers, Amelia enters, and her hands trace his book as she whispers back the violin. At the ballet theater, Oliver is glancing at a painting, and Clarissa has wandered into the venue, causing Ernest to glance at Clarissa and turn away. Ernest approaches, and later at dusk in the thriving village of Ferrenville, Ernest and Clarissa are standing in a stationary carousel, where Clarissa is laughing and reveals the silver harmonica case. Ernest snatches it from her and jumps out of the carousel, signaling to Harold and Graham. Keeping their heads low, the three of them stroll across to one shop and then tiptoe towards the bakery building flying the flag of Italy. Clarissa's curious eyes watch intently from inside the carousel as she marvels at the sight of fireworks popping amid the sound of music and grips her own tambourine. Inside the bakery, Graham is caught, and Harold dances back, surprising two bakers. Clarissa shivers as Ernest leaps towards the next room and is shouted at by the head baker, but not before sweeping him to the floor. Ernest bursts into the room, flings open the cupboard of small flour bags, and gathers them into a basket. Harold tiptoes over the bakery counter, reaches for the typewriter, and dents it with the palm of his hand, but a baker rushes in and showers Harold with pies. Ernest dashes back into the front room and pushes down the baker, clutching the ribbon on his hat, while Clarissa's face is full of anticipation as the carousel whirls out of the village. Smirking with delight, Ernest reveals the bundle of flour bags, and the carousel's lights shimmer against the quiet of the countryside. Sometime later, Robert conducts the concert, as in his library, Clarissa is battling the laughter. At dessert time, as guests mingle in groups, Felix is standing at the cake table and gazes at Edgar. Both raise spoons, but Felix stares at Clarissa's tired smiling face and the dimples on her cheeks and lowers his spoon, then strides off, his smile crooked, as Edgar observes Clarissa relax and Amelia also looks relieved. Edgar's eyes soften with relief. At the ballet theater, Ernest is standing on his own as Nolan, one of his troop, kneels down by a basin of water, his shoes and socks drenched. Ernest's eyes glimmer with understanding. In his room, Oliver, wide-awake, is practicing the flute with Marcus sitting by him humming. Oliver refills another cup of tea, and Ernest indicates Marcus, who doesn't appear to be interested, prompting Oliver to pat him on the back. Marcus glances at this friend and looks up at Ernest, as Oliver dismisses the moment with a shrug of his shoulders, and Ernest exits the room.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: As Tuvia contemplates the greenhouse full of anxious birds, Lilka comes in, and his eyes scan her shoes as she hands back the telescope. At the artist's commune, Viktor is looking at a tapestry, and Tuvia has entered the commune, causing Zus to glance at Tuvia and spin away. Zus approaches, and later at night in the deserted village of Stakiewicze, Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a tethered hot air balloon, where Tuvia is sneezing and produces the ornate kaleidoscope. Zus grabs it from him and slides out of the basket, waving to Benzion and Krensky. Keeping their heads low, the three of them shuffle across to one building and then creep towards the theater building flying the pirate flag. Tuvia's feverish eyes watch anxiously from inside the basket as he gasps at the sight of lanterns flickering amid the sound of fireworks and grips his own slingshot. Inside the theater, Krensky is struck down, and Benzion throws back, toppling two actors. Tuvia quivers as Zus dives towards the next dressing room and is aimed at by the director, but not before lassoing him to the ground. Zus rushes into the dressing room, flings open the cabinet of small perfume bottles, and dumps them into a sack. Benzion leaps over the theater counter, reaches for the phonograph, and shatters it with the hilt of his knife, but a stagehand bursts in and showers Benzion with confetti. Zus rushes back into the main lobby and slings down the stagehand, clutching the bruise on his arm, while Tuvia's face is full of dread as the balloon soars out of the village. Grimacing with discomfort, Zus produces the bundle of perfume bottles, and the balloon's lanterns illuminate the tranquility of the meadow. Sometime later, Shimon conducts the concert, as in his tent, Tuvia is battling the chills. At lunchtime, as people cluster in groups, Arkady is standing at the dessert table and sneers at Asael. Both draw spoons, but Arkady gazes at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the dark lines under his eyes and pockets his spoon, then strolls off, his lip curled, as Asael watches Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks concerned. Asael's eyes blaze with resentment. At the artist's commune, Zus is sitting on his own as Lova, one of his group, kneels down by a bucket of paint, his face and hands covered in clay. Zus's eyes flicker in irritation. In his yurt, Viktor, bleary-eyed, is strumming the mandolin with Gramov sitting by him humming. Viktor pours another glass of tea, and Zus indicates Gramov, who doesn't appear to be focusing, prompting Viktor to flick him across the head. Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus, as Viktor dismisses the incident with a nod of his head, and Zus exits the yurt.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As Rufus imagines the greenhouse teeming with sleepy bunnies, Margo enters, and his ears detect her presence as she returns the trumpet. At the festival ground, Felix is staring at a diagram, and Rufus has strolled into the yard, prompting Byron to glance at Rufus and stroll away. Byron approaches, and later in the evening at the vacant city of Tweedle, Byron and Rufus are lounging in a stationary canoe, where Rufus is sneezing and reveals the elaborate maraca. Byron snatches it from him and leaps out of the raft, gesturing to Mason and Dallas. Keeping their heads low, the trio dashes toward a structure and then creeps towards the library building hoisting the pirate flag. Rufus's weary ears listen intently from inside the canoe as he jumps at the sight of lanterns glowing amid the sound of tambourines and clutches his own maraca. Inside the library, Dallas is struck down, and Mason retaliates, eliminating two librarians. Rufus quivers as Byron lunges towards the next room and is targeted by the librarian chief, but not before toppling him to the floor. Byron strides into the room, throws open the closet of tiny spice jars, and sweeps them into a pouch. Mason leaps over the reference desk, reaches for the megaphone, and shatters it with the handle of his banjo, but a librarian charges in and peppers Mason with confetti. Byron dashes back into the main room and scatters the librarian, clutching the skewer in his thigh, while Rufus's face is full of dread as the canoe zooms out of the city. Grimacing with discomfort, Byron reveals the pile of spice jars, and the canoe's lanterns slice through the stillness of the country river. Hours later, Nigel conducts the ceremony, as in his greenhouse, Rufus is battling the chills. At mealtime, as creatures gather in flocks, Leonard is standing at the dessert cart and glowers at Dante. Both unsheath forks, but Leonard stares at Rufus's haggard long ears and the dark lines beneath his eyes and stows his fork, then wanders off, his nose twisted, as Dante observes Rufus retreat and Margo also looks worried. Dante's nostrils flare with fury. At the festival ground, Byron is lounging by himself as Simon, one of his ensemble, crouches by a kettle of soup, his fur and paws smeared in ketchup. Byron's nostrils flare with irritation. In his tent, Felix, squinting, is strumming the guitar with Clark sitting nearby chirping. Felix pours another cup of cider, and Byron acknowledges Clark, who appears to be ignoring everything, prompting Felix to tickle him across the nose. Clark peeks at this commanding rabbit and looks up at Byron, as Felix dismisses the occurrence with a flick of his paw, and Byron exits the tent.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As Tuvia considers the sick people in the cabin, Lilka returns his revolver. At the army camp, Tuvia's arrival causes Zus to turn away. Later, in the vacant town of Stakiewicze, Tuvia and Zus sit in a vehicle; Tuvia is ill and shows an ornate Mezuzah case. Zus grabs it and, with Benzion and Krensky, sneaks towards a Nazi-occupied police station. Tuvia, feverish, watches from the vehicle as gunfire erupts. Krensky is killed, Benzion retaliates, but dies while destroying a transmitter. Zus retrieves medicine bottles. Though wounded, he kills a policeman and escapes with Tuvia. Later, Shimon conducts a burial as Tuvia battles a fever. At mealtime, Arkady confronts Asael but retreats upon seeing Tuvia's frail condition. Asael glares furiously. At the camp, Zus is alone while Lova washes off blood, angering Zus. In Viktor's tent, a drunken incident occurs, but Viktor dismisses it, prompting Zus to leave.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Gramov glances at this commanding officer and looks up at Zus as Viktor dismisses the incident with a wave of his hand and Zus leaves the tent Viktor pours another glass of vodka and Zus indicates Gramov who doesn't appear to be paying attention prompting Viktor to swipe him across the face  In his tent Viktor blearyeyed is playing the accordion with Gramov sitting by him whistling  Zus's eyes flicker in anger  one of his group kneels down by a basin of water his face and hands covered in blood  At the army camp Zus is sitting on his own as Lova  Asael's eyes blaze with anger  Tuvia withdraw and Lilka also looks anxious  Both draw knives but Arkady stares at Tuvia's drawn pale face and the black rings under his eyes and sheathes his knife then saunters off his lip curled as Asael watches  At mealtime as people huddle in groups Arkady is standing at the food table and glares at Asael  Tuvia is fighting the fever  Sometime later Shimon officiates the burial as in his cabin  Wincing with pain Zus produces the bundle of medicine bottles and the truck's headlights pierce the bliss of the country road  Zus runs back into the front office and guns down the policeman clutching the wound in his stomach while Tuvia's face is full of foreboding as the vehicle hurtles out of the town  Benzion vaults over the police counter reaches for the transmitter and smashes it with the butt end of his rifle but a policeman bursts in and plants Benzion with bullets  Zus runs into the office flings open the cupboard of small medicine bottles and scoops them up into a sack  Tuvia trembles as Zus dives towards the next office and is shot at by the police chief but not before gunning him to the ground  Inside the police station Krensky is shot dead and Benzion fires back killing two policemen  Tuvia's feverish eyes watch nervously from inside the vehicle as he starts at the sight of lights flashing amid the sound of gunfire and grips his own gun  Keeping their heads low the three of them scurry across to one building and then sneak towards the police station building flying the Nazi flag  Zus snatches it from him and climbs out of the truck signaling to Benzion and Krensky  Zus comes up and later at night in the deserted town of Stakiewicze Zus and Tuvia are sitting in a parked vehicle where Tuvia is coughing and produces the ornate Mezuzah case  At the army camp Viktor is looking at a chart and Tuvia has come into the camp causing Zus to look at Tuvia and turn away  As Tuvia contemplates the cabin full of sick people Lilka comes in and his eyes search her face as she hands back the revolver
